results.title: Koalas [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian wildlife”.
The Koala’s popular image is as a sleepy, little creature. This film captures him in a more frolicsome mood - running, swimming and climbing. Active or drowsy, however, the Koala is always a popular subject. Also attmpts to correct some of the misconceptions about koalas. In Italian.

results.title: Platypus cove
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Geoffrey Gardiner and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Jim Mason is a 15 year old street struggling to stay on the right side of the law. He lands a job on a tugboat from Platypus Cove and things seem to be looking up. His peace is shattered however when he becomes the number one suspect for a sabotage attempt on the boat. It’s up to Jim and his crew of friends to catch the real culprits in a race around Sydney harbour. No year of production available.

results.title: Plasmo
results.creator_credit: Anthony Lawrence, Tony Wright, Beyond International, Film Victoria and Plasmo Mega Studios
results.brief_description: Plasmo, Parsty and Nik Nik are stuck on the planet Pynco, desperate to return home, when they come across two explorers, Brucho and Coredor. This tape includes seven adventures previously screened on ABC television. Episodes include: PLASMO AND THE MOONTOWER, PLASMO BLASTS OFF, PLASMO IN DEEP SPACE, PLASMO ARRIVES, TOUR OF MONJOTROLDECLIPDOC, PLASMO AND THE SPACE GHOSTS, PLASMO AND THE BOOKWORM. The magic of puppetry and animation used to create Plasmo’s world will delight children everywhere. Voices provided by Abbe Holmes, Pia Morley and Phil Houghton.

results.title: Plas Newydd, Angelsey, Wales
results.brief_description: Plas Newydd, which means “new house”, is the country home of the Marquis of Angelsey, Wales. The film examines this stately home and the present Marquis of Angelsey discusses its history. Part of the series “A Place in Europe”.

results.title: Planes, trains and automobiles
results.brief_description: It’s Thanksgiving and Neal Page (Steve Martin) is looking forward to spending some quality time with the family. While on the flight home, Neal is seated next to obnoxious shower curtain ring salesman Del Griffith (John Candy). When a snow storm causes their plane to be rerouted, the two are reluctantly united by their misfortune. Thus begins a disastrous chain of events that transcends all forms of public transport and threatens to make Neal miss Thanksgiving all together.

results.title: Plan 9 from outer space = Grave robbers from outer space
results.creator_credit: Edward Wood Jr and Reynolds Pictures
results.brief_description: The local authorities join forces with the military to ward off an invasion of flying saucers. Undeterred, the aliens continue their attempt to conquer Earth by resurrecting corpses from a San Fernando cemetery. “Plan 9 from outer space” has been described as the worst film ever made. This dubious honour has led to the cult status and notoriety the film enjoys to this day, proving that any publicity is good publicity. Those who have seen Tim Burton’s homage, “Ed Wood”, will enjoy seeing this original masterpiece. Bela Lugosi played the definitive vampire as Count Dracula in Tod Browning’s 1931 classic horror. In “Plan 9”, he revives his ghoulish persona in this, his final screen role.

results.title: Placido: a year in the life of Placido Domingo
results.creator_credit: Revel Guest, Group W, Channel 4 and Transatlantic Films
results.brief_description: Documentary made for television portraying a year in the life of one of the greatest opera singers of our time, Placido Domingo. This charming and charismatic performer takes us on a journey around the world from the major opera houses such as the Royal Opera House Covent Garden and La Scala Milan, to the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. He also manages to include appearances on television shows with Carol Burnett in Los Angeles and Charles Aznavour in Paris. The film includes excerpts from his performances in Tosca, The Tales of Hoffmann, Ernani, Otello, La fanciulla del West, Manon Lescaut and the Zeffirelli film of La Traviata. Also features Dame Kiri te Kanawa in Die Fledermaus.

results.title: Pixillation
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Knowlton, Lillian Schwartz and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: An experiment in film art using computer graphics and music by the Moog synthesiser. Inventive combinations of colour, form and motion have been produced. Music by Gershon Kingsley; crystal growth and computer graphics by Bell Labs.

results.title: Pity me not = Without each other
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, III Task Pictures and PMN Productions
results.brief_description: A drama about circus life and those who are a part of the circus family - in particular, a young trapeze artist played by Tony Anthony. Cast also includes Brud Talbot, Anne Hegira, Michael Dunn, Bob White, Barbara Biggart, Ann Harris. Music composed and conducted by Dimitri Tiomkin.
